page.title: 02Port Lympne. The Gardens.
page.content: The surrounds to the house were originally planned by Sir Philip Sasson, but were neglected for thirty years until restored by the present owner, Mr.John Aspinall. The classical gardens are remarkable both for their size, (15acres), and for their diversity. There is a striped garden, a chequered garden, and herbaceous borders, all planned with meticulous attention to colour. The terraces are planted with figs and vines, which echo Port Lympne's historical association with the Roman occupation. There is a magnificent stone Trojan Staircase, pools, a wishing well and beautiful stone walls. There are several deep springs on the estate so that there has never been a shortage of water.
